name: Kaaterskill Falls
access: Marked trail from NY-23A upper or lower lots; heavy use on weekends.
description: Iconic two-tier plunge; one of NY’s tallest and most photographed waterfalls.

name: Bastion Falls (Lower Kaaterskill)
access: Roadside viewpoint along NY-23A; connects to Kaaterskill Falls trail.
description: Roadside cascade at the mouth of Kaaterskill Clove; gateway to the main falls.

name: Plattekill Falls
access: Steep, rugged Platte Clove trails; seasonal road closures.
description: Sheer drop into a narrow, dramatic clove; slippery rock—use caution.

name: Diamond Notch Falls
access: Moderate hike via Diamond Notch trail from Spruceton Rd.
description: Twin-drop falls in a deep forest notch; classic Catskills backcountry vibe.

name: Awosting Falls
access: Short walk from Minnewaska main lot; family-friendly.
description: Graceful plunge into a broad amphitheater pool; easy access with big payoff.

name: Stony Kill Falls (Minnewaska)
access: Short, rocky trail from Stony Kill Falls lot; limited parking.
description: Tall horsetail drop with ledge views; great volume after rain.

name: Verkeerderkill Falls
access: Longer hike from Sam’s Point; exposed ledges near brink.
description: One of the tallest Shawangunk falls, dropping off the Shawangunk Ridge escarpment.

name: Taughannock Falls
access: Overlook by car; easy gorge trail to base when open.
description: Towering free-fall drop higher than Niagara’s American Falls; classic shale amphitheater.

name: Buttermilk Falls (Ithaca)
access: Multiple trails; lower park has a lifeguarded swim area in season.
description: Series of cascades over sculpted shale; quintessential Finger Lakes gorge.

name: Lucifer Falls (Robert H. Treman)
access: Gorge trail (seasonal) with stone stairways and overlooks.
description: Dramatic curtain of water framed by towering gorge walls and stonework.

name: Ithaca Falls
access: Short walk from Lake St.; caution near water.
description: Powerful urban waterfall at the mouth of Fall Creek; impressive even at low flow.

name: Triphammer Falls
access: View from campus bridges; limited close access.
description: Historic mill falls split by an island; scenic from the Thurston Ave bridge.

name: Cascadilla Falls
access: Stone stair gorge trail between Cornell campus and downtown (seasonal).
description: Tight series of drops through a narrow gorge with classic stonework.

name: Hector Falls
access: Roadside on NY-414; limited safe viewing areas.
description: Long, layered cascade tumbling toward Seneca Lake; roadside spectacle.

name: Watkins Glen (Rainbow Falls)
access: One-way gorge trail with stone bridges and tunnels; heavy visitation.
description: Signature curtain fall beneath a stone bridge—NY’s most famous gorge walk.

name: Shequaga Falls (Montour Falls)
access: Roadside pocket park; accessible viewpoint.
description: Tall plunge right in the village; dramatic after rains.

name: Aunt Sarah’s Falls
access: Roadside pull-off; limited parking.
description: Seasonal roadside horsetail—often paired with Shequaga on quick tours.

name: Eagle Cliff Falls (Havana Glen)
access: Short gorge walk from park; small fee in season.
description: Photogenic plunge into a round pool hemmed by fluted walls.

name: Deckertown Falls
access: Short, informal path from residential street—respect neighbors.
description: Compact gorge with a trio of small drops—quiet alternative to the main parks.

name: Chittenango Falls
access: Loop trail to base and overlooks; stairs can be slick.
description: Broad wedding-cake cascade; powerful after snowmelt.

name: Carpenter Falls
access: Short, sometimes muddy path; cliffs near brink—use caution.
description: Free-fall drop into a lush ravine feeding Skaneateles Lake.

name: Tinker Falls
access: Easy boardwalk + short climb; you can walk behind the falls.
description: Classic curtain you can go behind; family-friendly outing.

name: Fillmore Glen (Cowsheds Falls)
access: Gorge trail; seasonal swimming in park.
description: Picturesque shale gorge with multiple small falls and stone bridges.

name: High Falls (Rochester)
access: City overlooks and pedestrian bridge; lighting at night.
description: Urban powerhouse drop on the Genesee River amid old mills and rail bridges.

name: Middle Falls (Letchworth)
access: Multiple overlooks near the Glen Iris Inn.
description: The park’s marquee waterfall with constant mist and rainbows.

name: Upper Falls (Letchworth)
access: Short walk from Middle Falls area.
description: Graceful horseshoe beneath the high railroad arch (replaced by new bridge).

name: Lower Falls (Letchworth)
access: Longer stair route to overlook; rugged terrain.
description: Remote-feeling segment with stone bridges and deep gorge views.

name: Niagara Falls (American Falls & Bridal Veil)
access: Paved paths and overlooks; Cave of the Winds access in season.
description: World-class set of drops on the Niagara River; thunderous flow and constant mist.

name: Eternal Flame Falls
access: Rooty creek hike to a small grotto; slippery when wet.
description: Small cascade with a natural gas ‘flame’ flickering in a niche behind the water.

name: Akron Falls
access: Short walking paths within the county park.
description: Pretty ribbon drop in a wooded ravine; easy family outing.

name: Wiscoy Falls
access: Roadside pull-offs with informal paths; mind private property signs.
description: Wide cascade series over limestone shelves; photogenic at moderate flow.

name: Cohoes Falls
access: Developed overlooks; seasonal hours.
description: Massive curtain falls on the Mohawk River; awe-inspiring at high water.

name: Barberville Falls
access: Short preserve trails; seasonal closures possible.
description: Elegant plunge over a clean rock face into a tight amphitheater.

name: Mine Kill Falls
access: Short path to overlooks; stair access to lower views.
description: Tiered falls cutting through a narrow gorge above the Schoharie Creek.

name: Shelving Rock Falls
access: Easy walk from Shelving Rock Rd; multiple cascades nearby.
description: Graceful cascade near Lake George’s quiet eastern shore.

name: OK Slip Falls
access: 3-mile hike each way to a safe overlook; no base access.
description: One of the Adirondacks’ tallest free-falls into a wild, roadless gorge.

name: Split Rock Falls
access: Roadside pull-off; popular swimming holes—use caution.
description: Multiple punchbowl drops and flumes carved into smooth anorthosite.

name: Roaring Brook Falls
access: Short path from Route 73; base and upper viewpoint trails.
description: Long, lacy drop over a high slab—magnificent after heavy rain.

name: High Falls Gorge (AuSable)
park_or_area: Private attraction on the Ausable River
access: Boardwalks and bridges (admission).
description: Series of powerful drops through a tight volcanic dike gorge with safe viewpoints.

name: Rainbow Falls (Ausable Lakes)
access: AMR reservation system; long hike on private easement trails.
description: Tall, photogenic plume near the Lower Ausable Lake spillway.

name: Lampson Falls
access: Accessible path to overlook; sandy beach area below.
description: Wide, powerful sheet drop in a remote northern forest setting.

name: Indian Brook Falls
access: Short trail near Boscobel; small parking area.
description: Small but photogenic fall tucked in a ravine above Constitution Marsh.

name: Oxbow Falls
access: County park trails; variable flow later in summer.
description: Series of seasonal cascades along limestone ledges in a quiet county park.
